intro: Zeuxine erimae, commonly known as the mountain zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes a variety of herbaceous plants. The plant features delicate, showy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals. Its leaves are palmately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Zeuxine erimae thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
